alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 05 at 12:34AM PDT until November 06 at 12:13AM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Cowlitz River At Randle affecting Lewis County. .Six to nine inches of rain fell over the Central and Southern Washington Cascades Friday. The heavy rain has come to an end early Saturday morning. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cowlitz River At Randle. * WHEN...From early this morning to just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, the Cowlitz River will cause minor flooding from the vicinity of Randle downstream through Riffe Lake...covering nearby farm lands and several roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 AM PDT Saturday the stage was 15.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 20.0 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this morning at 845 AM PDT.
